akas: Un monstruo en la familia Spain
akas from release info: Un monstruo en la familia Spain

1.title: Grandma's Dying Wish
1.plot: After working through their issues last season, Fallon and Steve got married and moved in with Khalood in Michigan to save money. But their happiness was short-lived. Khalood is up to her old tricks again and things have gone from bad to worse.

2.title: Monster of the Bride 2: Under Khalood's Roof
2.plot: After working through their issues last season, Fallon and Steve got married and moved in with Khalood in Michigan to save money. But their happiness was short-lived. Khalood is up to her old tricks again and things have gone from bad to worse.

3.title: Beautii Is a Beast
3.plot: Esper's grip on her wrestler son Nick is so tight that she has a joint bank account with him, and won't let him have one with his own wife, Jessica.

4.title: Mama's Choke Hold
4.plot: After a hurricane damaged their house, Sheena and 2-year old Callie were forced to move in with Sheena's mother Sheeba--but her husband Dustin was not welcome--instead, he's verbally assaulted by Sheeba every time he steps foot in her home.

5.title: Hurricane Sheeba
5.plot: After a hurricane damaged their house, Sheena and 2-year old Callie were forced to move in with Sheena's mother Sheeba--but her husband Dustin was not welcome--instead, he's verbally assaulted by Sheeba every time he steps foot in her home.

6.title: Smother-in-Law
6.plot: The hatred between Robert's girlfriend, Heather, and his mother, Tammy, is so intense that Robert is terrified to put an engagement ring on Heather's finger even though they have a baby together.

7.title: The Doomed Groom
7.plot: The hatred between Robert's girlfriend, Heather, and his mother, Tammy, is so intense that Robert is terrified to put an engagement ring on Heather's finger even though they have a baby together.

9.title: Auntie Dearest
9.plot: Mark and Liz let Liz's sister, Rebecca, move into their home when she fell on hard times. Fast forward 2 years and Liz is still there, has not paid a dime in rent, has over-run their house with her eclectic furniture, terrorizes their teenage daughter.

10.title: Debbie Does Damage
10.plot: Kaitlin and Mark were so scared that Mark's overbearing mother, Debbie, would turn Kaitlin's 3-year-old daughter against them, they moved over 1,000 miles to get away from her.

18.title: Original Sin
18.plot: Mother-in-law Pat has never forgiven her daughter-in-law, Jen, for sleeping with her son, Chris, 10 years ago. Pat calls Jen, a "fat slut" and blames her for encouraging adopted Chris to find his birth mother.

1.title: The Last Italian Supper
1.plot: Anthony says starting a restaurant with his father-in-law is the worst mistake he's ever made, and he lives with that mistake every day. Strong-willed father-in-law Richie has driven a wedge into Anthony's relationship with his wife Kim and daughter Nina Maria. The tension runs so high Mel Robbins struggles to keep things from coming to blows.

2.title: Money Can't Buy a Grandbaby
2.plot: When Kristin met her husband Scott, she had already cut her monster-like mother, Susan, from her life. Scott encouraged Kristin to heal her relationship with her mother but would soon regret that he did. Now that the couple are expecting their first child, Kristin's mother is more opinionated than ever about how the couple should live their lives.

3.title: Heroin Highway
3.plot: Heroin abuse in Chicago's affluent suburbs is reaching epidemic proportions, and the area's Eisenhower Expressway has become known as the "Heroin Highway" for all the smack that flows through it. We look at the lives of four addicts who have been caught up in clutches of what is increasingly a middle class nightmare.

4.title: Monster of the Bride
4.plot: Khalood has a single mission: to prevent her daughter Fallon from marrying fianc? Steve, and she'll stop at nothing to tear their relationship apart. Tom Kersting puts the whole family on the spot as they all must decide the fate of the pending nuptials.

5.title: Ton-in-Law (Santry)
5.plot: Brian is fat, and his live-in mother-in-law Teresa reminds him of that every chance she gets. Her non-stop insults have taken their toll on Brian's self-esteem and his marriage with Christine. If Teresa can't shape up, Mel Robbins will ship her out.

6.title: Meaty Issues (Melnick)
6.plot: Vegetarian Amy has had enough of her live-in boyfriend's intrusive, loud-mouthed mother-in-law, Doreen. Amy and Mike are trying to raise their children vegetarian, but Doreen disregards Amy's wishes and brings meat to the house. Expert Mel Robbins must teach Amy to speak up and Doreen to listen.

7.title: High School Rivals (Chepan)
7.plot: Fifteen years ago, Lori took Elizabeth's event on the swim team. Three years ago Lori married Elizabeth's brother. Elizabeth has never forgiven Lori for either and has spent years compiling a record of all the ways she believes Lori has wronged her. Tom Kersting must yank the family out of the past if they are to have any future at all.

8.title: Naughty Grandma (Hesser)
8.plot: For six months every year Christy stays with her daughter Jessica and her husband and kids, wreaking havoc on their tidy, structured, super healthy lives. Christy breaks every rule her son-in-law sets, and he's ready to kick her out. Mel Robbins has to dig deep, uncovering ghosts from the past, to fix the dysfunction.

9.title: Spoiled Brat-in-Law (Roller)
9.plot: Arlene thinks her stay-at-home mom daughter-in-law Cory is spoiled. Cory doesn't care if she never sees Arlene again, and husband Ed is caught squarely in the middle. These two women don't have anything in common or any love for each other, and Mel Robbins has her work cut out for her.

10.title: An Unfortunate Affair (Guernsey)
10.plot: After years of Sue telling her daughter Jody that she can do better than husband Jim, Jody's met someone else. Now the whole family is in shambles. Tom Kersting is confronted with the ultimate meddling mother-in-law and the huge mess she's created.

11.title: Everyone Has a Price
11.plot: Southern hot-head Ron is so fed up with his mother-in-law Patricia that he makes a shocking offer: take $100,000 and stay out of my family's life forever. If Mel Robbins can't fix the family, will Patricia take the money and run?

-1.title: Pregnant and Addicted
-1.plot: We go to the Nexus Recovery Center in Dallas, Tex., to follow the gripping stories of four women who are struggling with both addiction and motherhood. Viewers meet Chenera, who is five months pregnant and whose drug addiction may force authorities to take away the two children she already has; Amanda, the mother of a two-month-old baby who is fighting to stay away from fast money and hard drug.

imdb.plot outline: Monster In-Laws follows married couples in dire straits. One spouse is at their breaking point, caught in the middle between their loudmouth relatives and the person they married. Using tough love and unconventional methods to push the families to their limits, the show's experts bring everyone under one roof and force them to uncover the deeper issues. Although they get caught in the crossfire, our experts are able to dig deep and resolve the point of contention, returning our couple to marital bliss.
imdb.title: Monster in-Laws
plot: Monster In-Laws follows married couples in dire straits. One spouse is at their breaking point, caught in the middle between their loudmouth relatives and the person they married. Using tough love and unconventional methods to push the families to their limits, the show's experts bring everyone under one roof and force them to uncover the deeper issues. Although they get caught in the crossfire, our experts are able to dig deep and resolve the point of contention, returning our couple to marital bliss.
